alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 16 at 5:58AM AKDT until March 17 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW FOLLOWED BY HEAVY RAIN FOR SOUTHEAST ALASKA... .Snow continues to fall over the northern Panhandle this morning. Heavy snow over the far northern Panhandle will last well into Thursday, especially at higher elevations and along the Klondike and Haines Highways. For those along the Icy Strait corridor, temperatures have warmed enough through the evening and overnight for the transition to all rain to occur. For Yakutat, the main plume of moisture will shift to the west with significant snow accumulations expected Friday afternoon into Friday night. There is still a bit of uncertainty as to where the heaviest plume of moisture will track and whether surface temperatures will remain cold enough for significant accumulations. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Yakutat. * WHEN...From 6 PM Thursday to 10 AM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate snow will fall through Thursday afternoon with heavy snow starting Thursday evening into Friday morning. The main plume of moisture will shift to the west with significant snow accumulations expected Friday afternoon into Friday night. There is still a bit of uncertainty as to where the heaviest plume of moisture will track and whether surface temperatures will remain cold enough for significant accumulations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
